title.raw: 《黥布列傳》 Biography of Qing Bu

sentences.zh: 黥布者，六人也，姓英氏。

translations.literal: Qing Bu, Liu person, surname Ying clan.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Bu was a native of Liu. His surname was Ying.

sentences.zh: 秦時為布衣。

translations.literal: Qin time as common cloth.
translations.idiomatic: During the Qin dynasty, he was a commoner.

sentences.zh: 少年，有客相之曰：「當刑而王。」

translations.literal: Young, have guest physiognomize him say: Should punishment then wang.
translations.idiomatic: As a youth, a guest physiognomist examined him and said: 'You should suffer punishment and then become king.'

sentences.zh: 及壯，坐法黥。

translations.literal: When mature, sit law tattoo.
translations.idiomatic: When he grew up, he was convicted under the law and tattooed.

sentences.zh: 布欣然笑曰；

translations.literal: Bu joyfully laugh say:
translations.idiomatic: Bu laughed joyfully and said:

sentences.zh: 「人相我當刑而王，幾是乎？」

translations.literal: Person physiognomize I should punishment then wang, nearly is?
translations.idiomatic: 'The physiognomist said I should suffer punishment and then become king. Is this nearly so?'

sentences.zh: 人有聞者，共俳笑之。

translations.literal: People have hear, together clown laugh him.
translations.idiomatic: Those who heard this laughed at him mockingly.

sentences.zh: 布已論輸麗山，麗山之徒數十萬人，布皆與其徒長豪桀交通，乃率其曹偶，亡之江中為群盜。

translations.literal: Bu already sentenced transport Li Shan, Li Shan followers several ten thousand people, Bu all with their leader brave heroes communicate, then lead their group companions, flee to Jiang middle as group bandit.
translations.idiomatic: After Bu was sentenced and transported to Lishan, where there were several hundred thousand convicts, Bu made contact with all the leaders and heroes among them. He then led his group of companions and fled into the Jiang marshes to become bandits.

sentences.zh: 陳勝之起也，布乃見番君，與其眾叛秦，聚兵數千人。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng rise, Bu then see Fan jun, with his multitude rebel Qin, gather troops several thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: When Chen Sheng rose up, Bu went to see Lord Fan and, together with his followers, rebelled against Qin, gathering several thousand troops.

sentences.zh: 番君以其女妻之。

translations.literal: Fan jun with his daughter marry him.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Fan married his daughter to him.

sentences.zh: 章邯之滅陳勝，破呂臣軍，布乃引兵北擊秦左右校，破之清波，引兵而東。

translations.literal: Zhang Han destroy Chen Sheng, defeat Lü Chen army, Bu then lead troops north strike Qin left right commanders, defeat them Qing Bo, lead troops east.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhang Han destroyed Chen Sheng and defeated Lü Chen's army, Bu led troops north to attack Qin's left and right commanders, defeating them at Qingbo, then led his troops east.

sentences.zh: 聞項梁定江東會稽，涉江而西。

translations.literal: Hear Xiang Liang pacify Jiang Dong Kuaiji, ford Jiang west.
translations.idiomatic: Hearing that Xiang Liang had pacified Jiangdong and Kuaiji, he forded the Yangtze and went west.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰以項氏世為楚將，乃以兵屬項梁，渡淮南，英布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬項梁。

translations.literal: Chen Ying with Xiang clan generations as Chu general, then with troops belong Xiang Liang, cross Huai south, Ying Bu, Pu general also with troops belong Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ying, recognizing that the Xiang clan had been generals of Chu for generations, placed his troops under Xiang Liang's command. Crossing south of the Huai, Ying Bu and General Pu also placed their troops under Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 項梁涉淮而西，擊景駒、秦嘉等，布常冠軍。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang ford Huai west, strike Jing Ju, Qin Jia etc, Bu often lead army.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang forded the Huai and went west, attacking Jing Ju, Qin Jia, and others. Bu often led the vanguard.

sentences.zh: 項梁至薛，聞陳王定死，迺立楚懷王。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang arrive Xue, hear Chen wang definitely dead, then establish Chu Huai wang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang reached Xue and, hearing that the King of Chen was certainly dead, established the King of Chu Huai.

sentences.zh: 項梁號為武信君，英布為當陽君。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang title as Wu Xin jun, Ying Bu as Dang Yang jun.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang was titled Lord Wuxin, and Ying Bu was titled Lord Dangyang.

sentences.zh: 項梁敗死定陶，懷王徙都彭城，諸將英布亦皆保聚彭城。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang defeat die Ding Tao, Huai wang move capital Peng Cheng, various generals Ying Bu also all defend gather Peng Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: After Xiang Liang was defeated and died at Dingtao, King Huai moved his capital to Pengcheng. The various generals, including Ying Bu, all defended and gathered at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦急圍趙，趙數使人請救。

translations.literal: At this time, Qin urgently surround Zhao, Zhao several times send people request rescue.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin was urgently besieging Zhao, and Zhao repeatedly sent people requesting rescue.

sentences.zh: 懷王使宋義為上將，范曾為末將，項籍為次將，英在、蒲將軍皆為將軍，悉屬宋義，北救趙。

translations.literal: Huai wang make Song Yi as supreme general, Fan Zeng as rear general, Xiang Ji as deputy general, Ying Bu, Pu general all as generals, all belong Song Yi, north rescue Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai appointed Song Yi as supreme commander, Fan Zeng as rear commander, Xiang Ji as deputy commander, and Ying Bu and General Pu as generals. All were placed under Song Yi's command to rescue Zhao in the north.

sentences.zh: 及項籍殺宋義於河上，懷王因立籍為上將軍，諸將皆屬項籍。

translations.literal: When Xiang Ji kill Song Yi at river upper, Huai wang then establish Ji as supreme general, various generals all belong Xiang Ji.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Ji killed Song Yi north of the Yellow River, King Huai then appointed Ji as supreme commander, with all the generals under Xiang Ji's command.

sentences.zh: 項籍使布先渡河擊秦，布數有利，籍迺悉引兵涉河從之，遂破秦軍，降章邯等。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji make Bu first cross river strike Qin, Bu several times have advantage, Ji then all lead troops ford river follow him, then defeat Qin army, surrender Zhang Han etc.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji ordered Bu to cross the river first and attack Qin. Bu repeatedly gained advantages, so Ji then led all his troops across the river to follow him, and they defeated the Qin army, capturing Zhang Han and others.

sentences.zh: 楚兵常勝，功冠諸侯。

translations.literal: Chu troops often victory, merit crown various marquises.
translations.idiomatic: Chu troops were constantly victorious, their merits surpassing all the other lords.

sentences.zh: 諸侯兵皆以服屬楚者，以布數以少敗眾也。

translations.literal: Various marquises troops all thereby submit belong Chu, because Bu several times with few defeat many.
translations.idiomatic: The troops of all the other lords submitted to Chu because Bu repeatedly defeated superior forces with inferior numbers.

sentences.zh: 項籍之引兵西至新安，又使布等夜擊阬章邯秦卒二十餘萬人。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji lead troops west arrive Xin An, again make Bu etc night strike pit Zhang Han Qin troops twenty more ten thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Ji led his troops west to Xin'an, he again ordered Bu and others to attack at night and bury alive over two hundred thousand Qin troops under Zhang Han.

sentences.zh: 至關，不得入，又使布等先從閒道破關下軍，遂得入，至咸陽。

translations.literal: [Translation: 至關，不得入，又使布等先從閒道破關下軍，遂得入，至咸陽。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 至關，不得入，又使布等先從閒道破關下軍，遂得入，至咸陽。]

sentences.zh: 布常為軍鋒。

translations.literal: [Translation: 布常為軍鋒。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 布常為軍鋒。]

sentences.zh: 項王封諸將，立布為九江王，都六。

translations.literal: [Translation: 項王封諸將，立布為九江王，都六。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 項王封諸將，立布為九江王，都六。]

sentences.zh: 漢元年四月，諸侯皆罷戲下，各就國。

translations.literal: [Translation: 漢元年四月，諸侯皆罷戲下，各就國。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 漢元年四月，諸侯皆罷戲下，各就國。]

sentences.zh: 項氏立懷王為義帝，徙都長沙，乃陰令九江王布等行擊之。

translations.literal: [Translation: 項氏立懷王為義帝，徙都長沙，乃陰令九江王布等行擊之。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 項氏立懷王為義帝，徙都長沙，乃陰令九江王布等行擊之。]

sentences.zh: 其八月，布使將擊義帝，追殺之郴縣。

translations.literal: [Translation: 其八月，布使將擊義帝，追殺之郴縣。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 其八月，布使將擊義帝，追殺之郴縣。]

sentences.zh: 漢二年，齊王田榮畔楚，項王往擊齊，徵兵九江，九江王布稱病不往，遣將將數千人行。

translations.literal: [Translation: 漢二年，齊王田榮畔楚，項王往擊齊，徵兵九江，九江王布稱病不往，遣將將數千人行。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 漢二年，齊王田榮畔楚，項王往擊齊，徵兵九江，九江王布稱病不往，遣將將數千人行。]

sentences.zh: 漢之敗楚彭城，布又稱病不佐楚。

translations.literal: [Translation: 漢之敗楚彭城，布又稱病不佐楚。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 漢之敗楚彭城，布又稱病不佐楚。]

sentences.zh: 項王由此怨布，數使使者誚讓召布，布愈恐，不敢往。

translations.literal: [Translation: 項王由此怨布，數使使者誚讓召布，布愈恐，不敢往。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 項王由此怨布，數使使者誚讓召布，布愈恐，不敢往。]

sentences.zh: 項王方北憂齊、趙，西患漢，所與者獨九江王，又多布材，欲親用之，以故未擊。

translations.literal: [Translation: 項王方北憂齊、趙，西患漢，所與者獨九江王，又多布材，欲親用之，以故未擊。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 項王方北憂齊、趙，西患漢，所與者獨九江王，又多布材，欲親用之，以故未擊。]

sentences.zh: 漢三年，漢王擊楚，大戰彭城，不利，出梁地，至虞，謂左右曰：「如彼等者，無足與計天下事。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 漢三年，漢王擊楚，大戰彭城，不利，出梁地，至虞，謂左右曰：「如彼等者，無足與計天下事。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 漢三年，漢王擊楚，大戰彭城，不利，出梁地，至虞，謂左右曰：「如彼等者，無足與計天下事。」]

sentences.zh: 謁者隨何進曰：「不審陛下所謂。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 謁者隨何進曰：「不審陛下所謂。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 謁者隨何進曰：「不審陛下所謂。」]

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「孰能為我使淮南，令之發兵倍楚，留項王於齊數月，我之取天下可以百全。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 漢王曰：「孰能為我使淮南，令之發兵倍楚，留項王於齊數月，我之取天下可以百全。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 漢王曰：「孰能為我使淮南，令之發兵倍楚，留項王於齊數月，我之取天下可以百全。」]

sentences.zh: 隨何曰：「臣請使之。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 隨何曰：「臣請使之。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 隨何曰：「臣請使之。」]

sentences.zh: 乃與二十人俱，使淮南。

translations.literal: [Translation: 乃與二十人俱，使淮南。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 乃與二十人俱，使淮南。]

sentences.zh: 至，因太宰主之，三日不得見。

translations.literal: [Translation: 至，因太宰主之，三日不得見。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 至，因太宰主之，三日不得見。]

sentences.zh: 隨何因說太宰曰：「王之不見何，必以楚為彊，以漢為弱，此臣之所以為使。

translations.literal: [Translation: 隨何因說太宰曰：「王之不見何，必以楚為彊，以漢為弱，此臣之所以為使。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 隨何因說太宰曰：「王之不見何，必以楚為彊，以漢為弱，此臣之所以為使。]

sentences.zh: 使何得見，言之而是邪，是大王所欲聞也；

translations.literal: [Translation: 使何得見，言之而是邪，是大王所欲聞也；]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 使何得見，言之而是邪，是大王所欲聞也；]

sentences.zh: 言之而非邪，使何等二十人伏斧質淮南市，以明王倍漢而與楚也。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 言之而非邪，使何等二十人伏斧質淮南市，以明王倍漢而與楚也。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 言之而非邪，使何等二十人伏斧質淮南市，以明王倍漢而與楚也。」]

sentences.zh: 太宰乃言之王，王見之。

translations.literal: [Translation: 太宰乃言之王，王見之。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 太宰乃言之王，王見之。]

sentences.zh: 隨何曰：「漢王使臣敬進書大王御者，竊怪大王與楚何親也。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 隨何曰：「漢王使臣敬進書大王御者，竊怪大王與楚何親也。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 隨何曰：「漢王使臣敬進書大王御者，竊怪大王與楚何親也。」]

sentences.zh: 淮南王曰：「寡人北鄉而臣事之。」

translations.literal: [Translation: 淮南王曰：「寡人北鄉而臣事之。」]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 淮南王曰：「寡人北鄉而臣事之。」]

sentences.zh: 隨何曰：「大王與項王俱列為諸侯，北鄉而臣事之，必以楚為彊，可以託國也。

translations.literal: [Translation: 隨何曰：「大王與項王俱列為諸侯，北鄉而臣事之，必以楚為彊，可以託國也。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 隨何曰：「大王與項王俱列為諸侯，北鄉而臣事之，必以楚為彊，可以託國也。]

sentences.zh: 項王伐齊，身負板筑，以為士卒先，大王宜悉淮南之眾，身自將之，為楚軍前鋒，今乃發四千人以助楚。

translations.literal: [Translation: 項王伐齊，身負板筑，以為士卒先，大王宜悉淮南之眾，身自將之，為楚軍前鋒，今乃發四千人以助楚。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 項王伐齊，身負板筑，以為士卒先，大王宜悉淮南之眾，身自將之，為楚軍前鋒，今乃發四千人以助楚。]

sentences.zh: 夫北面而臣事人者，固若是乎？

translations.literal: [Translation: 夫北面而臣事人者，固若是乎？]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 夫北面而臣事人者，固若是乎？]

sentences.zh: 夫漢王戰於彭城，項王未出齊也，大王宜騷淮南之兵渡淮，日夜會戰彭城下，大王撫萬人之眾，無一人渡淮者，垂拱而觀其孰勝。

translations.literal: [Translation: 夫漢王戰於彭城，項王未出齊也，大王宜騷淮南之兵渡淮，日夜會戰彭城下，大王撫萬人之眾，無一人渡淮者，垂拱而觀其孰勝。]
translations.idiomatic: [Translation: 夫漢王戰於彭城，項王未出齊也，大王宜騷淮南之兵渡淮，日夜會戰彭城下，大王撫萬人之眾，無一人渡淮者，垂拱而觀其孰勝。]

sentences.zh: 夫託國於人者，固若是乎？

translations.literal: Indeed entrust country to person, firmly like this?
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, is this how one entrusts their country to another?

sentences.zh: 大王提空名以鄉楚，而欲厚自託，臣竊為大王不取也。

translations.literal: Great wang carry empty name face Chu, but wish thick self entrust, minister secretly for great wang not take.
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty bears an empty title while facing Chu, yet wishes to richly entrust yourself. This minister secretly thinks Your Majesty should not do this.

sentences.zh: 然而大王不背楚者，以漢為弱也。

translations.literal: However great wang not turn back Chu, because Han as weak.
translations.idiomatic: However, the reason Your Majesty does not turn away from Chu is because you consider Han weak.

sentences.zh: 夫楚兵雖彊，天下負之以不義之名，以其背盟約而殺義帝也。

translations.literal: Indeed Chu troops though strong, world bear it with unrighteous name, because its break alliance agreement kill righteous emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, though Chu's troops are strong, the world bears Chu with the name of unrighteousness because it broke alliance agreements and killed the Righteous Emperor.

sentences.zh: 然而楚王恃戰勝自彊，漢王收諸侯，還守成皋、滎陽，下蜀、漢之粟，深溝壁壘，分卒守徼乘塞，楚人還兵，閒以梁地，深入敵國八九百里，欲戰則不得，攻城則力不能，老弱轉糧千里之外；

translations.literal: However Chu wang rely battle victory self strong, Han wang gather various marquises, return guard Cheng Gao, Xing Yang, descend Shu, Han grain, deep moat rampart, divide troops guard border multiply barrier, Chu people return troops, separate with Liang land, deep enter enemy country eight nine hundred li, wish battle then not obtain, attack city then strength not able, old weak transport grain thousand li outside;
translations.idiomatic: However, the Chu king relies on his battle victories to consider himself strong. The Han king has gathered the various lords and returned to guard Chenggao and Xingyang. He receives grain from Shu and Han, digs deep moats and builds strong ramparts, divides his troops to guard the borders and barriers. When Chu returns troops, separated by Liang territory, they penetrate deep into enemy territory eight or nine hundred li. They want to fight but cannot, attack cities but lack the strength, while the old and weak transport grain from a thousand li away.

sentences.zh: 楚兵至滎陽、成皋，漢堅守而不動，進則不得攻，退則不得解。

translations.literal: Chu troops arrive Xing Yang, Cheng Gao, Han firmly guard not move, advance then not obtain attack, retreat then not obtain release.
translations.idiomatic: When Chu troops reach Xingyang and Chenggao, Han firmly guards without moving. They cannot attack by advancing, nor can they withdraw and disengage.

sentences.zh: 故曰楚兵不足恃也。

translations.literal: Therefore say Chu troops not sufficient rely.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said that Chu's troops are not sufficient to rely upon.

sentences.zh: 使楚勝漢，則諸侯自危懼而相救。

translations.literal: Make Chu win Han, then various marquises self danger fear mutually rescue.
translations.idiomatic: If Chu defeats Han, then the various lords will fear for their own safety and mutually come to each other's rescue.

sentences.zh: 夫楚之彊，適足以致天下之兵耳。

translations.literal: Indeed Chu strength, exactly sufficient bring world troops.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, Chu's strength is exactly sufficient to bring forth troops from all under heaven.

sentences.zh: 故楚不如漢，其勢易見也。

translations.literal: Therefore Chu not as Han, its situation easy see.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Chu is not equal to Han - this situation is easy to see.

sentences.zh: 今大王不與萬全之漢而自託於危亡之楚，臣竊為大王惑之。

translations.literal: Now great wang not with ten thousand complete Han but self entrust at danger perish Chu, minister secretly for great wang confused it.
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty does not ally with the perfectly secure Han but entrusts yourself to the endangered and perishing Chu. This minister is secretly confused on Your Majesty's behalf.

sentences.zh: 臣非以淮南之兵足以亡楚也。

translations.literal: Minister not with Huai Nan troops sufficient destroy Chu.
translations.idiomatic: This minister does not say that Huai'nan's troops are sufficient to destroy Chu.

sentences.zh: 夫大王發兵而倍楚，項王必留；

translations.literal: Indeed great wang send troops double Chu, Xiang wang must stay;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, if Your Majesty sends troops and turns against Chu, Xiang Yu will certainly stay;

sentences.zh: 留數月，漢之取天下可以萬全。

translations.literal: Stay several months, Han take world can ten thousand complete.
translations.idiomatic: If he stays for several months, Han's taking of the world can be accomplished with complete security.

sentences.zh: 臣請與大王提劍而歸漢，漢王必裂地而封大王，又況淮南，淮南必大王有也。

translations.literal: Minister request with great wang carry sword return Han, Han wang must tear land seal great wang, moreover Huai Nan, Huai Nan must great wang have.
translations.idiomatic: This minister requests to go with Your Majesty, carrying swords, to return to Han. The Han king will certainly tear off land to enfeoff Your Majesty, not to mention Huai'nan - Huai'nan will certainly belong to Your Majesty.

sentences.zh: 故漢王敬使使臣進愚計，願大王之留意也。」

translations.literal: Therefore Han wang respectfully send envoy minister advance foolish plan, wish great wang carefully consider.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Han king respectfully sends this envoy minister to advance a foolish plan, and hopes Your Majesty will give it careful consideration.'

sentences.zh: 淮南王曰：「請奉命。」

translations.literal: Huai Nan wang say: Please receive command.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Huai'nan said: 'I will respectfully follow your command.'

sentences.zh: 陰許畔楚與漢，未敢泄也。

translations.literal: Secretly promise rebel Chu with Han, not dare leak.
translations.idiomatic: He secretly promised to rebel against Chu and ally with Han, but did not dare let it leak out.

sentences.zh: 楚使者在，方急責英布發兵，舍傳舍。

translations.literal: Chu envoy present, just urgently demand Ying Bu send troops, dwell relay lodge.
translations.idiomatic: A Chu envoy was present, just then urgently demanding that Ying Bu send troops, staying at the relay lodge.

sentences.zh: 隨何直入，坐楚使者上坐，曰：「九江王已歸漢，楚何以得發兵？」

translations.literal: Sui He straight enter, sit Chu envoy upper seat, say: Jiu Jiang wang already return Han, Chu what with obtain send troops?
translations.idiomatic: Sui He went straight in, sat in the seat above the Chu envoy, and said: 'The King of Jiujiang has already returned to Han. How can Chu obtain troops from him?'

sentences.zh: 布愕然。

translations.literal: Bu astonished.
translations.idiomatic: Bu was astonished.

sentences.zh: 楚使者起。

translations.literal: Chu envoy rise.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu envoy rose.

sentences.zh: 何因說布曰：「事已搆，可遂殺楚使者，無使歸，而疾走漢并力。」

translations.literal: He then persuade Bu say: Matter already formed, can then kill Chu envoy, no make return, quickly go Han combine strength.
translations.idiomatic: He then persuaded Bu, saying: 'The matter is already formed. You can kill the Chu envoy now so he cannot return, and quickly go to Han to combine forces.'

sentences.zh: 布曰：「如使者教，因起兵而擊之耳。」

translations.literal: Bu say: Like envoy teach, then raise troops strike it.
translations.idiomatic: Bu said: 'As the envoy teaches, then I will raise troops and attack them.'

sentences.zh: 於是殺使者，因起兵而攻楚。

translations.literal: Thereupon kill envoy, then raise troops attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon they killed the envoy, then raised troops and attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚使項聲、龍且攻淮南，項王留而攻下邑。

translations.literal: Chu send Xiang Sheng, Long Ju attack Huai Nan, Xiang wang stay attack Xia Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Chu sent Xiang Sheng and Long Ju to attack Huai'nan, while Xiang Yu stayed behind to attack Xiayi.

sentences.zh: 數月，龍且擊淮南，破布軍。

translations.literal: Several months, Long Ju strike Huai Nan, defeat Bu army.
translations.idiomatic: Several months later, Long Ju attacked Huai'nan and defeated Bu's army.

sentences.zh: 布欲引兵走漢，恐楚王殺之，故閒行與何俱歸漢。

translations.literal: Bu wish lead troops flee Han, fear Chu wang kill him, therefore secretly go with He together return Han.
translations.idiomatic: Bu wished to lead his troops in flight to Han, but feared that the Chu king would kill him, so he secretly went together with Sui He to return to Han.

sentences.zh: 淮南王至，上方踞床洗，召布入見，布（甚）大怒，悔來，欲自殺。

translations.literal: Huai Nan wang arrive, emperor just sit cross-legged bed wash, summon Bu enter see, Bu greatly angry, regret come, wish suicide.
translations.idiomatic: When the King of Huai'nan arrived, the emperor was just sitting cross-legged on his bed bathing. He summoned Bu to enter and see him. Bu was greatly angered, regretted coming, and wished to commit suicide.

sentences.zh: 出就舍，帳御飲食從官如漢王居，布又大喜過望。

translations.literal: Go out to lodge, tent imperial food drink attendants officials like Han wang residence, Bu again greatly happy exceed expectation.
translations.idiomatic: He went out to his quarters, where the tent, imperial food and drink, and attendant officials were just like the Han king's residence. Bu was again greatly pleased, exceeding his expectations.

sentences.zh: 於是乃使人入九江。

translations.literal: Thereupon then send people enter Jiu Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he sent people to enter Jiujiang.

sentences.zh: 楚已使項伯收九江兵，盡殺布妻子。

translations.literal: Chu already send Xiang Bo gather Jiu Jiang troops, all kill Bu wife children.
translations.idiomatic: Chu had already sent Xiang Bo to gather the Jiujiang troops and kill all of Bu's wives and children.

sentences.zh: 布使者頗得故人幸臣，將眾數千人歸漢。

translations.literal: Bu envoy considerably obtain old friends favored ministers, lead multitude several thousand people return Han.
translations.idiomatic: Bu's envoy considerably obtained old friends and favored ministers, leading several thousand people to return to Han.

sentences.zh: 漢益分布兵而與俱北，收兵至成皋。

translations.literal: Han moreover distribute Bu troops and with together north, gather troops arrive Cheng Gao.
translations.idiomatic: Han moreover distributed Bu's troops and went north together with him, gathering troops until they reached Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 四年七月，立布為淮南王，與擊項籍。

translations.literal: Fourth year seventh month, establish Bu as Huai Nan wang, with strike Xiang Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of the fourth year, Bu was established as King of Huai'nan, and joined in attacking Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 漢五年，布使人入九江，得數縣。

translations.literal: Han fifth year, Bu send people enter Jiu Jiang, obtain several counties.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Han, Bu sent people to enter Jiujiang and obtained several counties.

sentences.zh: 六年，布與劉賈入九江，誘大司馬周殷，周殷反楚，遂舉九江兵與漢擊楚，破之垓下。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Bu with Liu Jia enter Jiu Jiang, entice grand marshal Zhou Yin, Zhou Yin rebel Chu, then raise Jiu Jiang troops with Han strike Chu, defeat it Gai Xia.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Bu together with Liu Jia entered Jiujiang, enticed the Grand Marshal Zhou Yin, who rebelled against Chu. They then raised Jiujiang troops together with Han to attack Chu, defeating them at Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 項籍死，天下定，上置酒。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji die, world pacified, emperor set wine.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji died and the world was pacified. The emperor held a wine feast.

sentences.zh: 上折隨何之功，謂何為腐儒，為天下安用腐儒。

translations.literal: Emperor belittle Sui He merit, call He rotten Confucian, for world what use rotten Confucian.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor belittled Sui He's merit, calling him a rotten Confucian, asking what use a rotten Confucian was to the world.

sentences.zh: 隨何跪曰：「夫陛下引兵攻彭城，楚王未去齊也，陛下發步卒五萬人，騎五千，能以取淮南乎？」

translations.literal: Sui He kneel say: Indeed your majesty lead troops attack Peng Cheng, Chu wang not leave Qi, your majesty send infantry fifty thousand people, cavalry five thousand, can with take Huai Nan?
translations.idiomatic: Sui He knelt and said: 'Indeed, Your Majesty led troops to attack Pengcheng while the Chu king had not yet left Qi. If Your Majesty had sent fifty thousand infantry and five thousand cavalry, could you have taken Huai'nan?'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「不能。」

translations.literal: Emperor say: Cannot.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'I could not.'

sentences.zh: 隨何曰：「陛下使何與二十人使淮南，至，如陛下之意，是何之功賢於步卒五萬人騎五千也。

translations.literal: Sui He say: Your majesty send He with twenty people envoy Huai Nan, arrive, like your majesty intention, is He merit surpass infantry fifty thousand people cavalry five thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Sui He said: 'Your Majesty sent me and twenty others as envoys to Huai'nan. We arrived and accomplished Your Majesty's intentions. Thus my merit surpasses that of fifty thousand infantry and five thousand cavalry.

sentences.zh: 然而陛下謂何腐儒，為天下安用腐儒，何也？」

translations.literal: However your majesty call He rotten Confucian, for world what use rotten Confucian, what?
translations.idiomatic: However Your Majesty calls me a rotten Confucian, asking what use a rotten Confucian is to the world. Why is this?'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「吾方圖子之功。」

translations.literal: Emperor say: I just plan your merit.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'I am just now considering your merit.'

sentences.zh: 乃以隨何為護軍中尉。

translations.literal: Then with Sui He as protect army central captain.
translations.idiomatic: Then Sui He was appointed as Protector of the Army and Central Captain.

sentences.zh: 布遂剖符為淮南王，都六，九江、廬江、衡山、豫章郡皆屬布。

translations.literal: Bu then divide tally as Huai Nan wang, capital Liu, Jiu Jiang, Lu Jiang, Heng Shan, Yu Zhang commanderies all belong Bu.
translations.idiomatic: Bu then divided the tally and became King of Huai'nan, with his capital at Liu. The Jiujiang, Lujiang, Hengshan, and Yuzhang commanderies all belonged to Bu.

sentences.zh: 七年，朝陳。

translations.literal: Seventh year, court Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he paid court at Chen.

sentences.zh: 八年，朝雒陽。

translations.literal: Eighth year, court Luo Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he paid court at Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 九年，朝長安。

translations.literal: Ninth year, court Chang An.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, he paid court at Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 十一年，高后誅淮陰侯，布因心恐。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Gao empress execute Huai Yin hou, Bu therefore heart fear.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Empress Gao executed the Marquis of Huaiyin, and Bu therefore became fearful in his heart.

sentences.zh: 夏，漢誅梁王彭越，醢之，盛其醢遍賜諸侯。

translations.literal: Summer, Han execute Liang wang Peng Yue, pickle him, fill his pickle extensively grant various marquises.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Han executed the King of Liang Peng Yue, pickled his body, and distributed the pickle widely to all the lords.

sentences.zh: 至淮南，淮南王方獵，見醢，因大恐，陰令人部聚兵，候伺旁郡警急。

translations.literal: Arrive Huai Nan, Huai Nan wang just hunt, see pickle, therefore greatly fear, secretly order people organize gather troops, wait watch side commanderies alert urgent.
translations.idiomatic: When it arrived in Huai'nan, the King of Huai'nan was just hunting. He saw the pickle and was greatly terrified. He secretly ordered people to organize and gather troops, waiting and watching for alerts from neighboring commanderies.

sentences.zh: 布所幸姬疾，請就醫，醫家與中大夫賁赫對門，姬數如醫家，賁赫自以為侍中，乃厚餽遺，從姬飲醫家。

translations.literal: Bu favored concubine ill, request go to doctor, doctor house with central grand master Fen He opposite door, concubine several times go doctor house, Fen He self consider attendant middle, then thick give gifts, follow concubine drink doctor house.
translations.idiomatic: Bu's favored concubine fell ill and requested to go to the doctor. The doctor's house was opposite that of the Central Grand Master Fen He. The concubine went to the doctor's house several times. Fen He considered himself a palace attendant and gave her rich gifts, accompanying her to drink at the doctor's house.

sentences.zh: 姬侍王，從容語次，譽赫長者也。

translations.literal: Concubine serve wang, leisurely speak sequence, praise He elder.
translations.idiomatic: The concubine served the king, and in leisurely conversation praised He as an elder worthy of respect.

sentences.zh: 王怒曰：「汝安從知之？」

translations.literal: Wang angry say: You how from know it?
translations.idiomatic: The king angrily said: 'How did you come to know this?'

sentences.zh: 具說狀。

translations.literal: Fully explain situation.
translations.idiomatic: She fully explained the situation.

sentences.zh: 王疑其與亂。

translations.literal: Wang suspect her with rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: The king suspected her of involvement in the rebellion.

sentences.zh: 赫恐，稱病。

translations.literal: He fear, claim illness.
translations.idiomatic: He became fearful and claimed illness.

sentences.zh: 王愈怒，欲捕赫。

translations.literal: Wang more angry, wish arrest He.
translations.idiomatic: The king became even more angry and wished to arrest He.

sentences.zh: 赫言變事，乘傳詣長安。

translations.literal: He speak change matter, ride relay go Chang An.
translations.idiomatic: He reported the matter of rebellion and rode the relay post to Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 布使人追，不及。

translations.literal: Bu send people pursue, not reach.
translations.idiomatic: Bu sent people to pursue him, but they did not catch up.

sentences.zh: 赫至，上變，言布謀反有端，可先未發誅也。

translations.literal: He arrive, report rebellion, say Bu plot rebel have signs, can before not issue execute.
translations.idiomatic: When He arrived, he reported the rebellion, saying that Bu was plotting rebellion with clear signs, and could be executed before he acted.

sentences.zh: 上讀其書，語蕭相國。

translations.literal: Emperor read his letter, tell Xiao prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor read his letter and told Prime Minister Xiao.

sentences.zh: 相國曰：「布不宜有此，恐仇怨妄誣之。

translations.literal: Prime minister say: Bu not suitable have this, fear enmity grudge falsely accuse him.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister said: 'Bu should not have such intentions. I fear this is a false accusation born of enmity and grudges.

sentences.zh: 請擊赫，使人微驗淮南王。」

translations.literal: Request strike He, send people secretly verify Huai Nan wang.'
translations.idiomatic: I request that He be beaten, and people sent to secretly verify the King of Huai'nan.'

sentences.zh: 淮南王布見赫以罪亡，上變，固已疑其言國陰事；

translations.literal: Huai Nan wang Bu see He with crime flee, report rebellion, firmly already suspect his speak country secret matters;
translations.idiomatic: The King of Huai'nan Bu saw that He had fled on account of a crime and reported rebellion. He was already firmly suspicious that He had spoken of the country's secret matters.

sentences.zh: 漢使又來，頗有所驗，遂族赫家，發兵反。

translations.literal: Han envoy again come, considerably have verification, then exterminate He clan, raise troops rebel.
translations.idiomatic: Han envoys came again and found considerable verification. Thereupon he exterminated He's clan and raised troops in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 反書聞，上乃赦賁赫，以為將軍。

translations.literal: Rebel letter heard, emperor then pardon Fen He, make as general.
translations.idiomatic: When the letter of rebellion was heard, the emperor then pardoned Fen He and made him a general.

sentences.zh: 上召諸將問曰：「布反，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Emperor summon various generals ask say: Bu rebel, for it what do?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor summoned the various generals and asked: 'Bu has rebelled. What can be done about it?'

sentences.zh: 皆曰；

translations.literal: All say:
translations.idiomatic: All said:

sentences.zh: 「發兵擊之，阬豎子耳。

translations.literal: Send troops strike him, pit young child.
translations.idiomatic: 'Send troops to attack him. Bury that young scoundrel.

sentences.zh: 何能為乎！」

translations.literal: What able do!'
translations.idiomatic: What can he do!'

sentences.zh: 汝陰侯滕公召故楚令尹問之。

translations.literal: Ru Yin hou Teng gong summon former Chu prime minister ask him.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Ruyin, Duke Teng, summoned the former Chu prime minister and asked him.

sentences.zh: 令尹曰：「是故當反。」

translations.literal: Prime minister say: This reason should rebel.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister said: 'This is exactly why he should rebel.'

sentences.zh: 滕公曰：「上裂地而王之，疏爵而貴之，南面而立萬乘之主，其反何也？」

translations.literal: Teng gong say: Emperor tear land wang him, enfeoff rank noble him, south face stand ten thousand chariots lord, his rebel why?
translations.idiomatic: Duke Teng said: 'The emperor tore off land to make him king, enfeoffed him with rank and nobility, allowed him to sit facing south as lord of ten thousand chariots. Why would he rebel?'

sentences.zh: 令尹曰：「往年殺彭越，前年殺韓信，此三人者，同功一體之人也。

translations.literal: Prime minister say: Past year kill Peng Yue, before year kill Han Xin, this three people, same merit one body people.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister said: 'Last year Peng Yue was killed, the year before Han Xin was killed. These three men were people of the same merit and shared the same fate.

sentences.zh: 自疑禍及身，故反耳。」

translations.literal: Self doubt calamity reach body, therefore rebel.'
translations.idiomatic: He feared calamity would reach his own person, therefore he rebelled.'

sentences.zh: 滕公言之上曰：「臣客故楚令尹薛公者，其人有籌筴之計，可問。」

translations.literal: Teng gong speak to emperor say: Minister guest former Chu prime minister Xue gong, he have strategem plan, can ask.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Teng spoke to the emperor, saying: 'My guest, the former Chu prime minister Lord Xue, has strategic plans. He can be asked.'

sentences.zh: 上乃召見問薛公。

translations.literal: Emperor then summon see ask Xue gong.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then summoned Lord Xue to see and question him.

sentences.zh: 薛公對曰：「布反不足怪也。

translations.literal: Xue gong answer say: Bu rebel not sufficient strange.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Xue replied: 'Bu's rebellion is not at all surprising.

sentences.zh: 使布出於上計，山東非漢之有也；

translations.literal: Make Bu come out upper plan, Shan Dong not Han have;
translations.idiomatic: If Bu follows the best strategy, Shandong will not belong to Han;

sentences.zh: 出於中計，勝敗之數未可知也；

translations.literal: Come out middle plan, victory defeat number not yet know;
translations.idiomatic: If he follows the middle strategy, victory or defeat cannot be known;

sentences.zh: 出於下計，陛下安枕而臥矣。」

translations.literal: Come out lower plan, your majesty peaceful pillow lie.'
translations.idiomatic: If he follows the worst strategy, Your Majesty can sleep peacefully on your pillow.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「何謂上計？」

translations.literal: Emperor say: What call upper plan?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'What is the best strategy?'

sentences.zh: 令尹對曰：「東取吳，西取楚，并齊取魯，傳檄燕、趙，固守其所，山東非漢之有也。」

translations.literal: Prime minister answer say: East take Wu, west take Chu, combine Qi take Lu, transmit manifesto Yan, Zhao, firmly guard their place, Shan Dong not Han have.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister replied: 'East take Wu, west take Chu, combine with Qi to take Lu, send manifestos to Yan and Zhao, firmly guard their positions, and Shandong will not belong to Han.'

sentences.zh: 「何謂中計？」

translations.literal: What call middle plan?
translations.idiomatic: 'What is the middle strategy?'

sentences.zh: 「東取吳，西取楚，并韓取魏，據敖庾之粟，塞成皋之口，勝敗之數未可知也。」

translations.literal: East take Wu, west take Chu, combine Han take Wei, occupy Ao Yu grain, block Cheng Gao mouth, victory defeat number not yet know.
translations.idiomatic: 'East take Wu, west take Chu, combine with Han to take Wei, occupy the grain at Aoyu, block the mouth at Chenggao, and victory or defeat cannot be known.'

sentences.zh: 「何謂下計？」

translations.literal: What call lower plan?
translations.idiomatic: 'What is the worst strategy?'

sentences.zh: 「東取吳，西取下蔡，歸重於越，身歸長沙，陛下安枕而臥，漢無事矣。」

translations.literal: East take Wu, west take Xia Cai, return heavy to Yue, body return Chang Sha, your majesty peaceful pillow lie, Han no affairs.
translations.idiomatic: 'East take Wu, west take Xia Cai, entrust the heavy responsibility to Yue, return his person to Changsha, and Your Majesty can sleep peacefully on your pillow. Han will have no troubles.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「是計將安出？」

translations.literal: Emperor say: This plan will where come?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'Which strategy will he follow?'

sentences.zh: 令尹對曰：「出下計。」

translations.literal: Prime minister answer say: Come lower plan.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister replied: 'He will follow the worst strategy.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「何謂廢上中計而出下計？」

translations.literal: Emperor say: What call abandon upper middle plan come lower plan?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'Why would he abandon the best and middle strategies and follow the worst?'

sentences.zh: 令尹曰：「布故麗山之徒也，自致萬乘之主，此皆為身，不顧後為百姓萬世慮者也，故曰出下計。」

translations.literal: Prime minister say: Bu originally Li Shan followers, self reach ten thousand chariots lord, this all for body, not consider after for common people ten thousand generations consider, therefore say come lower plan.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister said: 'Bu was originally a follower from Lishan. He raised himself to become lord of ten thousand chariots. All this was for his own sake, without considering the future or planning for the common people for ten thousand generations. Therefore he will follow the worst strategy.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Emperor say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 封薛公千戶。

translations.literal: Enfeoff Xue gong thousand households.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Xue was enfeoffed with a thousand households.

sentences.zh: 乃立皇子長為淮南王。

translations.literal: Then establish imperial son Chang as Huai Nan wang.
translations.idiomatic: Then the imperial son Chang was established as King of Huai'nan.

sentences.zh: 上遂發兵自將東擊布。

translations.literal: Emperor then send troops self lead east strike Bu.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then sent troops, personally leading them east to attack Bu.

sentences.zh: 布之初反，謂其將曰：「上老矣，厭兵，必不能來。

translations.literal: Bu initial rebel, tell his generals say: Emperor old, weary troops, must not able come.
translations.idiomatic: When Bu first rebelled, he told his generals: 'The emperor is old and weary of war. He certainly cannot come.

sentences.zh: 使諸將，諸將獨患淮陰、彭越，今皆已死，餘不足畏也。」

translations.literal: Send various generals, various generals only fear Huai Yin, Peng Yue, now all already dead, remainder not sufficient fear.'
translations.idiomatic: If he sends the various generals, the generals only feared Huaiyin and Peng Yue. Now they are all dead, the remainder are not worth fearing.'

sentences.zh: 故遂反。

translations.literal: Therefore then rebel.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he proceeded with the rebellion.

sentences.zh: 果如薛公籌之，東擊荊，荊王劉賈走死富陵。
盡劫其兵，渡淮擊楚。
楚發兵與戰徐、僮閒，為三軍，欲以相救為奇。
或說楚將曰：「布善用兵，民素畏之。
且兵法，諸侯戰其地為散地。
今別為三，彼敗吾一軍，餘皆走，安能相救！」
不聽。
布果破其一軍，其二軍散走。
遂西，與上兵遇蘄西，會甀。
布兵精甚，上乃壁庸城，望布軍置陳如項籍軍，上惡之。
與布相望見，遙謂布曰：「何苦而反？」
布曰：「欲為帝耳。」
上怒罵之，遂大戰。
布軍敗走，渡淮，數止戰，不利，與百餘人走江南。
布故與番君婚，以故長沙哀王使人紿布，偽與亡，誘走越，故信而隨之番陽。
番陽人殺布茲鄉民田舍，遂滅黥布。
立皇子長為淮南王，封賁赫為期思侯，諸將率多以功封者。
太史公曰：英布者，其先豈春秋所見楚滅英、六，皋陶之後哉？
身被刑法，何其拔興之暴也！
項氏之所阬殺人以千萬數，而布常為首虐。
功冠諸侯，用此得王，亦不免於身為世大僇。
禍之興自愛姬殖，妒媢生患，竟以滅國！
